Well, I need to update on my fully purchased copy of Crysis 2 from yesterday!  I must say I was very excited to finally install it and start playing.  It looked great, well some parts of it anyway.  Then I noticed the ground, trees, cars, and water looking like crap!!  I looked at my OSD and it said DX9!  Yes, this brand new game after years of development is rendered in DX9, and not DX11, or even DX10 like the last game!!  WTF!!  The tree's, ground, walls etc no longer have any depth like the first Crysis.  It looks like a PS3, or Xbox game for petes sake!!  Iâ€™m very disappointed to say the least, and Iâ€™m not feeling real good abou the $64.00 I spent for the game.  I like supporting the dev's that make great looking games, but this is severely disappointing to say the least!
How could Crytek take steps backwards in rendering technology after years of development???  What a joke!   Yes, the game looks great for DX9, but it looks NOTHING like the first game in terms of quality rendering.  Even the water does not look at good.   I will be taking this game back to where I bought it and getting my money back.  I have already uninstalled it as well!  I know console players generally donâ€™t care about the detail that DX10 and DX11 provide (or they would be playing on PC's), but us PC gamers spend a lot of money on the latest hardware/graphic cards to make use of the features we paid for, and for the "almighty Crysis" to be launched in such old technology (DX9) is just pathetic!  Hell, you canâ€™t even change the graphic settings in detail.  Just low, med, and high settings basically.  Crysis is now a confirmed console game, and the pc side of it is dead.  RIP Crysis!!!  Crytek said they would not forget about the PC gamer, well, they lied to us, and for that, I hope they sincerely loose a huge chunk of money from people who are pissed off and refuse to buy the game.  I was really wrong about supporting this game/company!  My sincere apologies everyone.  Pirate on

FLT  Crack worked perfect for me, here what I did :)

1. Download this torrent

2.Unpack it.

3.Place the entire unpacked folder in your C:\Program Files (86x) (86x is just for 64bit version of Windows)

4.Now go into the unpacked folder -> Crysis 2 -> _Installer -> DISK1 -> And run EASetup.

5. During the installation, choose a custom install folder, yup, you guessed it, install in the folder you just unpacked, and placed in your C:\Program (86x)

6. Now, download this crack -> http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6269026.

7. Unpack it -> Copy the crack to the bin32 folder, replace the .exe as usual.

8. After I did all this it worked like a charm for me :P
